cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DC, cs.CR, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with coding theory and information theory, which are typically covered under the cs.IT sub-category. The concept of interleaving is often used in data storage systems, which falls under the cs.DS sub-category. The paper also discusses the correction capability of the codes, which is related to error-correcting codes and could be classified under the cs.DC sub-category. The codes are designed to provide better reliability, which is a security concern and could be classified under the cs.CR sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the ability to access information at different granularities, which could be classified under the cs.SI sub-category.
